title: Colosseum , Italy
description: The Colosseum was the largest amphitheater in ancient Rome, accommodating up to 80,000 spectators. It exemplifies architectural excellence and social stratification, symbolizing entertainment and political control.

title: Great Wall (China)
description: The Great Wall is a monumental defensive structure of ancient China, stretching thousands of miles and incorporating walls, passes, and beacons. It reflects military ingenuity and rich historical value.

title: Petra (Jordan)
description: Petra is an ancient rock-carved city built by the Nabataeans. It blends diverse cultural influences with stunning natural surroundings, featuring temples, tombs, and a grand theater.

title: Christ the Redeemer (Brazil)
description: Standing 38 meters tall atop Corcovado Mountain, the Christ statue represents love and acceptance. It is a national symbol of Brazil and one of the world’s new seven wonders.

title: Machu Picchu (Peru)
description: Machu Picchu is an Incan royal estate located in the Andes at an altitude of 2,430 meters. Abandoned after the Spanish conquest, it features precise stonework and sacred structures.

title: Chichen Itza (Mexico)
description: Chichen Itza was a major Mayan city known for the Temple of Kukulcan. The site blends astronomy, religion, and politics, showcasing the Mayan civilization’s achievements.

title: Taj Mahal (India)
description: The Taj Mahal, located in Agra, India, was built by Mughal Emperor Shah Jahan in memory of his wife. Its white marble structure embodies love and eternal beauty.
